_header: All this book is I-maked of holy days and of holy mans lives
_description: A General Prologue in one MS of the South English Legendary, with special mention of ‘ȝeres day’ and Epiphany — twenty-six lines

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
Al þis bok is i maked of holi dawes and of holie mannes
                    liuesÞat soffreden for ore louerdes loue pinene manie and
                    riue…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Ase it falleȝ a twelfte dai longe heo erore him
                    fouȝtenGold and mirre and an sens In presaunt heo him
                    brouȝten
BodLauMis108.Note:
This version ends this story/text four lines later than the usual,
                    including in this stody the first four lines of 4594, ending, ‘He let him martri þere
                    fore and oþere with him mo’.
